Messages.Author: Philip Wietstock
Messages.Content: Dear all, Next week, our lecture block on hop aroma and dry hopping of beer will start. This lecture block will deal with hop aroma and dry hopping basics as well with 'standard' and more advanced hopping techniques. We will also have two guest lecturers as part of this lecture block. Please prepare for the next lecture (28.05.2024) by Watching the video: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/videoservice/view.php?id=1779131 Skim-reading the literature 1a-1e. The folders 1a to 1e contain a substantial amount of literature relevant to our topic. It is essential to begin reviewing these materials early. As you go through them, identify the most important information and note areas where you need to deepen your understanding.  The lecture discussion next week will be as an online-format via zoom. The link can be found on the ISIS site.  We are looking forward to discussing this topic with you.  Regards Philip

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Signing up for ABT examinations via MTS open

Messages.Author: Philip Wietstock
Messages.Content: Dear all, You can sign up for the oral examinations on MOSES/MTS: #31045v1: Advanced Brewing Technology (12 LP)  Examinations dates are: 05.09.2024 and 06.09.2024. Please pay attention to the MTS deadlines (sign up until 31.08.2024). If you are still planning to do the exam according to the old StuPO, please let us know.   Information for the examinations: At the beginning, the examinee independently presents a freely chosen topic from the scope of the lecture (duration 5 minutes, freely spoken, no PPT or similar, but a sketch can be made during the presentation). In the 5 minutes, details should be presented in as much depth as possible and the content area should be explained as fully as possible (i.e. it is better to narrow down the area and provide more details). Afterwards, further random content from the lecture content will be tested within 25 minutes.  Regards, Philip
